result.execSummary:
The defendant Lakeisha R Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit for three days in the event sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant is required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
Pay only the mandatory costs on or before the probationary period. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Maintain full time/part time employment and/or schooling.

No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
Not to be in possession of any firearms or weapons during the probationary period.
Court will consider expungement if the defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of probable cause finding.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 01/11/17. Cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment subject to tax intercept to be entered. 
*Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence; Huber release for work only, with credit for 72 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lakeisha R Scott

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTIONRECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Defendant Lakeisha R Scott in court with attorney Jeffrey Knight Welcenbach.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence; Huber release for work only, with credit for 72 days time served. 

- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 1/11/2017. Cash bail to apply.  Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment subject to tax intercept to be entered. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Appellate rights given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Original Transcript (35 pages) PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING, commencing FEBRUARY 8, 2016, received and filed.

PURSUANT TO Felony Division Directive 04-03 dated December 15, 2004 -
Per succession calendar this case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Davis, Br. 21, for sentencing after revocation of probation.  Sentencing transcript dated 2-8-16 requested from court reporter's office this date.  jm
Received from the Department of Corrections, Request for Sentencing After Revocation of Defendant's Probation.  jm
Scanned:  State Subpoena and Certificate of Service.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

Defendant has credit for 3 days. The Court WITHHELD the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 Year with the following conditions:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay ONLY the mandatory costs on or before the probationary period. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  Community service of 200 hours.
*  Not to be in possession of any firearms or weapons during the probationary period.
*  Defendant is required to provide a biological specimens (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.

Court will consider expungement if the Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Lakeisha R Scott in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Defendant Lakeisha R Scott in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties request adjourned Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lakeisha R Scott in court with tudent Intern Claire Ziebler under the supervision of attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Final pretrial held.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 10-21-2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 45.

Defendant Lakeisha R Scott in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lakeisha R Scott in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Lakeisha R Scott in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
